formalpara.title: Interner Hilfetext zu dieser Applikation in Asterisk 1.6:

para.screen:
-= Info about application 'OSPLookup' =-
[Synopsis] Lookup destination by OSP
[Description] OSPLookup(exten[,provider[,options]]): Looks up an extension via OSP and sets the variables, where 'n' is the number of the result beginning with 1: ${OSPOUTHANDLE}: The OSP Handle for anything remaining ${OSPTECH}: The technology to use for the call ${OSPDEST}: The destination to use for the call ${OSPCALLED}: The called number to use for the call ${OSPCALLING}: The calling number to use for the call ${OSPDIALSTR}: The dial command string ${OSPOUTTOKEN}: The actual OSP token as a string ${OSPOUTTIMELIMIT}: The outbound call duration limit in seconds ${OSPOUTCALLIDTYPES}: The outbound call id types ${OSPOUTCALLID}: The outbound call id ${OSPRESULTS}: The number of OSP results total remaining
The option string may contain the following character: 'h' -- generate H323 call id for the outbound call 's' -- generate SIP call id for the outbound call. Have not been implemented 'i' -- generate IAX call id for the outbound call. Have not been implemented This application sets the following channel variable upon completion: OSPLOOKUPSTATUS The status of the OSP Lookup attempt as a text string, one of SUCCESS | FAILED | ERROR

formalpara.title: Differenz des internen Hilfetexts von Asterisk 1.4 zu 1.6:
